test.expected-output: This program doesn't support printing a counter with more than four bytes yet.

test.description: The apeinspector must run successfully on this example.
The size of the binary item tag must match.
The item flags of the binary item must indicate binary data.
The item value type of the binary item must be 1 to indicate binary data.
The begin index of the item value type of the binary item must be correct.
The length of the item value type of the binary item must be correct.
The ItemKey for the binary data.
The ItemValue is the binary data.
The ItemValue is the binary data in a buffer.
The ItemValue is the binary data of integers.
The ItemValue is the binary data of 8bit values.
The ItemValue is the binary data of unsigned values.
The ItemValue has a specific length.
The ItemValue has a specific length.
The interpretation of the item value type of the binary item must indicate binary data.
The id3inspector must run successfully on this example.
The id3inspector must run successfully on this example.
If unsynchronization has been performed, this one bit needs to be set.
Testing the right tags on the flag bit field.
Testing the right tags on the flag bit field.
Testing the right tags on the flag bit field.
Testing the right tags on the flag bit field.
The flag Unsynchronisation needs to be set. This is an interpretation of the flags field.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
The flag ExtendedHeader must not be set fot his test.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
The flag ExperimentalIndicator must not be set for this test.
The flag ExperimentalIndicator is a bit.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
Testing the right tags on flag field.
This is the frame that will be unsynchronized.

Unfortunately, I have no example of unsynchronization in valuable payload data. Instead, I have an MCDI frame with bogus FF FF data at the end, but that data is unsynchronized which disturbs the following frame, if not de-unsynchronized correctly. Here we check for the bogus end error.
test.expected-output: The frame size is claimed larger than the actually handled size. See at the end of the frame for superfluous data.

test.description: The claimed size of the frame.
The unit for the claimed size.
This size of the frame must equal the claimed size.
The handled size of the frame without the bogus FF FF.
The unit for the handled size.
The rest size in the frame. The bogus FF FF at the end.
The unit for the rest size.
The bogus data at the end of the frame. Unsynchronized, this reads ff 00 ff.
The error tag for the rest data.
test.expected-output: This is additional unparsed data at the end of the frame.

test.description: The length of the rest data.
The unit for the length of the rest data.
This is the frame following the frame that is unsynchronized. It needs to be available and the right one.
The language field of the COMM frame must be "eng".
The interpretation of the language field of the COMM frame must be "English".
The standard for the interpretation of the language field of the COMM frame must be "ISO 639-2:1998 (alpha-3)".

test.expected-output: The language code consists of three null bytes. Although common, this is not valid.
Could not read a valid ASCII string to be interpreted as an ISO 639-2:1998 (alpha-3) language code.
The language code is an ASCII string but is not recognized as ISO 639-2:1998 (alpha-3).
The language code 'XXX' is only valid in ID3v2.4 to indicate an unknown language.
The language code consists of three null bytes. Although common, this is not valid.
The language code consists of three null bytes. Although common, this is not valid.
